column1: ISO/IEC 27001 is the world's best-known standard for information security management systems (ISMS). It defines requirements an ISMS must meet.
The ISO/IEC 27001 standard provides companies of any size and from all sectors of activity with guidance for establishing
column3: maintaining and continually improving an information security management system.

column1: Conformity with ISO/IEC 27001 means that an organization or business has put in place a system to manage risks related to the security of data owned or handled by the company
column2: and that this system respects all the best practices and principles enshrined in this International Standard.

column1: With cyber-crime on the rise and new threats constantly emerging
column2: it can seem difficult or even impossible to manage cyber-risks. ISO/IEC 27001 helps organizations become risk-aware and proactively identify and address weaknesses.

column1: ISO/IEC 27001 promotes a holistic approach to information security: vetting people
column2: policies and technology. An information security management system implemented according to this standard is a tool for risk management
